caption.p: Effects of RS and oseltamivir on virus production in lung and bronchoalveolar lavage fluid (BALF) samples of mice taken 3 or 7 days after IFV infection. IFV-infected mice were subcutaneously injected with or without 5-fluorouracil (5-FU) and were orally administered with water (closed columns, control), 5 mg RS (gray columns), and 0.5 mg oseltamivir (open columns). Virus yields in the ( a) lung and ( b) BALF samples are shown. Each value represents the mean Â± S.D ( n = 5). * p < 0.05, ** p < 0.01, *** p < 0.001 versus the control group. ## p < 0.01 against the oseltamivir-administered FU (-) group.
